original_title: Sri Lanka central bank staff to strike on March 01 over progressive taxes
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank staff will strike on March 01 over steeply progressive taxes to boost state finances amid the worst currency crisis in post-independent history.
Central Bank Trade Union Alliance said it will join 40 other unions representing professionals.
The unions have asked to amend “the oppressive tax policy being implemented which have been declined by the government.”
“Hence, an island-wide token strike will be in effect on 01st of March 2023 which is to be participated by the employees of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka,” the union alliance said.
Sri Lanka imposed steeply progressive taxes running up to 36 percent with slabs narrowed despite a currency collapse. (Colombo/Feb27/2023)
